Kitten
 Balanced Diet:Needs a balanced diet formulated for kittens to support growth and development. 
Vaccinations: Ensure your kitten receives all necessary vaccinations according to the veterinarian's schedule. 
Socialization: Introduce your kitten to various environments, people, and other animals to encourage social skills. 
Training: Start litter training and basic obedience training early.

Junior
Nutrition: Transition to adult cat food gradually, ensuring it meets the nutritional needs for their age. 
Exercise: Encourage playtime to keep them active and mentally stimulated. 
Spaying/Neutering: Consider spaying or neutering if not already done to prevent unwanted pregnancies and certain health issues. 
Dental Care: Introduce dental care routines to prevent dental problems later in life.

Adult
Routine Vet Checkups: Schedule regular veterinary checkups to monitor their health and catch any issues early. 
Weight Management: Monitor their weight and adjust food portions as necessary to prevent obesity. 
Environmental Enrichment: Provide plenty of opportunities for mental and physical stimulation through toys, scratching posts, and interactive play. 
Preventive Care: Stay consistent with flea, tick, and heartworm prevention.
